channel.title: Packard Bell on Tedium: The Dull Side of the Internet.
channel.description: Recent content in Packard Bell on Tedium: The Dull Side of the Internet.

item.title: The Many Lives of Packard Bell
item.description: Today in Tedium: Let’s go back in time about 20 years, to two days after Christmas, 1996. On this day, as I was becoming accustomed to Bush’s second album, millions of families around the United States were unpacking and setting up their first home computers. For those who skipped the Commodore and Apple II eras, who didn’t have a Videotex installed in their televisions, and had no idea who Commander Keen even was, this was the moment in time when they joined the internet revolution, brandishing their their AOL or Hotmail addresses for all the world to see.
